availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Calvin Brogan (Knox County, Kentucky, wagoner, grocer, and jailer)

body.p: Knox County, Kentucky, wagoner, grocer, and jailer. Tennessee native. Married to Mahala Payne Brogan. Father of Hiram Brogan, John Brogan, Amanda Brogan, Elizabeth Jane Brogan, Nancy Brogan, Richard Brogan, Green Brogan, and George Brogan. Married to Sarah Gibson Brogan. Father of Virginia “Jennie” Brogan and Isabel Brogan. Wagoner in Knox County, Kentucky, in 1850. Grocery keeper in Knox County in 1860. Jailer of the Knox County Jail in Barbourville in 1860. Jailer of the Knox County Jail in Barbourville in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Knox County, p. 366 B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Knox County, Barboursville, p. 26.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Knox County, Subdivision 93, p. 467 A.
“Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1862,” Legislative Document Series, No. 24 (Frankfort, Ky.: Wm. E. Hughes, State Printer, 1863), 304.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994044, Knox County Births.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994044, Knox County Marriages, p. 26-27.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #2338.
KYR-0001-021-0012.
